problem: What is the least prime factor of $7^4 - 7^3$?
solution: Factor out $7^3$ in the given expression $7^4-7^3=7^3(7-1)=7^3\cdot6=2\cdot3\cdot7^3$. Thus, the least prime factor of $7^4-7^3$ is $\boxed{2}$.
